benchmark_details.name: FullStack Bench
benchmark_details.overview: FullStack Bench is a comprehensive code evaluation dataset that spans multiple computer science domains and programming languages, containing 3374 problems. It is designed to assess large language models' capabilities in real-world code development scenarios.
benchmark_details.data_type: programming problems with unit test cases

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a holistic evaluation framework for code intelligence and to assess the multilingual programming capabilities of large language models in real-world scenarios.

data.source: Collected from real-world programming challenges and code-related documents, specifically curated for diverse application domains.
data.annotation: Systematic human annotation process for producing code samples across different application domains.

methodology.calculation: Evaluation metrics calculated based on the percentage of unit tests passed by the generated solutions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Pass@1 metrics indicate better performance of language models on the benchmark.
methodology.validation: Comprehensive experimental results validate the effectiveness of FullStack Bench.
